p: Second, urban planning may also become a necessary tool to prevent adverse birth outcomes. Urban heat is affected by albedo (reflectivity) and land use patterns. More specifically, as land use increases and reflectivity increases, the relative magnitude of UHI will also increase [ 52]. Increasing greenspace may reduce the ambient temperature of a given area, particularly through increasing canopy cover [ 52]. Without adequate urban planning and adaptation, cities will rely on air conditioning, an energy-intensive mitigation strategy, to reduce exposure [ 53].
